sentence.Network_en: China regrets the abrogation of the Anti - Ballistic Missile Treaty.
sentence.Network_cn: 中国对《 反 弹道导弹条约》失效感到遗憾.

sentence.Network_en: Measures for the abrogation shall be stipulated by the State Council.
sentence.Network_cn: 废除的办法由国务院制定.

sentence.Network_en: Not the abrogation of the free market.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GMAT重点词汇汇总A-B-GMAT考试-考试大 ... abolitionist n.废奴主义者 abrogation n.废除,废止 abscisic acid n.［生化］脱落酸.

list.abs: a government may abrogate any unfair treaties ., 政府可以取消任何不公平的条约.
The government can not cannot just abrogate contracts ., 国家不能只是废除合同.
单词【abrogate】的释义、短语及例句 ... 2:abrogate agreement 取消协议; 3:Abrogate Treaty 废除条约.
In the meeting , he abolished or abrogated some laws ., 会议中 , 他废止或废除了一些法律.

entry.tran: 废除，取消（法令、协议、习俗等）
entry.def: If someone in a position of authority abrogates something such as a law, agreement, or practice, they put an end to it.

example.ex: The next prime minister could abrogate the treaty.
example.tran: 下一任首相可能会废除这个条约。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of abrogating; an official or legal cancellation

auth_sentence.content: March - South warns North over unilateral abrogation of Korean War armistice and bellicose rhetoric.

auth_sentence.content: I then chronicled, for the next four years, her systematic abrogation of every commitment she had made to reform.
